ETYMOLOGY: From Middle French modelle, from Italian modello (diminutive of modo, 'measure, standard, manner'), ultimately from Latin modus ('measure, standard').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A three-dimensional representation of a person or thing, or a simplified description used to explain how something works.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某人或某事物的立体表现形式；用于解释某事物运作方式的简化描述或系统。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The engineers built a scale model of the new housing development.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 工程师们建造了新住宅开发的比例模型。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person employed to display clothes or other products, or to pose for an artist, sculptor, or photographer.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 受雇展示服装或其他产品的人，或为艺术家、雕塑家或摄影师摆姿势的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She left her corporate job to become a full-time fashion model.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她辞去了公司的工作，成为一名全职时装模特。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A particular design or version of a product, especially a car or machine.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某产品的特定设计或版本，尤指汽车或机器。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The latest model of this smartphone features an improved camera.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这款智能手机的最新型号配备了改进的摄像头。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To wear or display (clothes) as a fashion model.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 作为时装模特穿着或展示（服装）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She will be modeling the spring collection at the show.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她将在时装秀上展示春季系列。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To form or shape a figure or object out of a malleable material, such as clay or wax.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用粘土或蜡等可塑材料塑造（人物或物体）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sculptor modeled the bust in bronze.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 雕塑家用青铜塑造了半身像。

REGISTER: General usage, technical fields, and fashion industry.
